name: formal
description: A Pulumi package for creating and managing Formal resources.
attribution: This Pulumi package is based on the [`formal` Terraform Provider](https://github.com/formalco/terraform-provider-formal).

nodejs.packageDescription: A Pulumi package for creating and managing Formal resources.
nodejs.readme:
> This provider is a derived work of the [Terraform Provider](https://github.com/formalco/terraform-provider-formal)
> distributed under [MPL 2.0](https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/MPL/2.0/). If you encounter a bug or missing feature,
> first check the [`pulumi-formal` repo](https://github.com/formalco/pulumi-formal/issues); however, if that doesn't turn up anything,
> please consult the source [`terraform-provider-formal` repo](https://github.com/formalco/terraform-provider-formal/issues).

python.readme:
> This provider is a derived work of the [Terraform Provider](https://github.com/formalco/terraform-provider-formal)
> distributed under [MPL 2.0](https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/MPL/2.0/). If you encounter a bug or missing feature,
> first check the [`pulumi-formal` repo](https://github.com/formalco/pulumi-formal/issues); however, if that doesn't turn up anything,
> please consult the source [`terraform-provider-formal` repo](https://github.com/formalco/terraform-provider-formal/issues).

allowS3Access.description: Allows the Cloud Integration to access S3 buckets for Log Integrations.

awsCustomerRoleArn.description: The ARN of the IAM role that Formal assumes in your AWS account to access your resources.

enableEc2Autodiscovery.description: Enables resource autodiscovery for EC2 instances.

enableEcsAutodiscovery.description: Enables resource autodiscovery for ECS clusters.

enableEksAutodiscovery.description: Enables resource autodiscovery for EKS clusters.

enableRdsAutodiscovery.description: Enables resource autodiscovery for RDS instances (PostgreSQL, MySQL, MongoDB).

enableRedshiftAutodiscovery.description: Enables resource autodiscovery for Redshift clusters.

enableS3Autodiscovery.description: Enables resource autodiscovery for S3 buckets.

s3BucketArn.description: The S3 bucket ARN this Cloud Integration is allowed to use for Log Integrations.

templateVersion.description: The template version of the CloudFormation stack. Use `latest` to stay in sync.

apiKey.description: Api Key for the Datahub instance.

generalizedMetadataServiceUrl.description: Generalized metadata service url for the Datahub instance.

webhookSecret.description: Webhook secret of the Datahub instance.

apiKey.description: API Key of your Kandji organization.

apiUrl.description: API URL of your Kandji organization.

maxPayloadSize.description: Maximum size of request payloads to log.

policyEvalInputRetention.description: Duration to retain policy evaluation inputs for requests. Valid values: 1d, 2d, 3d, 7d, 14d, 21d, 30d.

encrypt.description: Whether to encrypt SQL queries in logs.

stripValues.description: Whether to obfuscate SQL queries in logs.

maxPayloadSize.description: Maximum size of response payloads to log.

policyEvalInputRetention.description: Duration to retain policy evaluation inputs for responses. Valid values: 1d, 2d, 3d, 7d, 14d, 21d, 30d.

connectorId.description: The ID of the connector (required when type is connector).

resourceId.description: The ID of the resource (required when type is resource).

spaceId.description: The ID of the space (required when type is space).

type.description: The type of scope (resource, connector, space, org).

policyEvalInputRetention.description: Duration to retain policy evaluation inputs for sessions. Valid values: 1d, 2d, 3d, 7d, 14d, 21d, 30d.

provider.description:
The provider type for the formal package. By default, resources use package-wide configuration
settings, however an explicit `Provider` instance may be created and passed during resource
construction to achieve fine-grained programmatic control over provider settings. See the
[documentation](https://www.pulumi.com/docs/reference/programming-model/#providers) for more information.

apiKey.description: Api key for the deployed Connector.

spaceId.description: The ID of the Space to create the Connector in.

terminationProtection.description: If set to true, this Connector cannot be deleted.

formal:index/connectorConfiguration:Conn.description: Registering a Connector Configuration with Formal.

connectorId.description: The ID of the Connector this configuration is linked to.

logLevel.description: The log level to be configured for this Connector.

otelEndpointHostname.description: The OpenTelemetry endpoint hostname for this Connector. Defaults to 'localhost'.

otelEndpointPort.description: The OpenTelemetry endpoint port for this Connector. Defaults to 4317.

resourcesHealthChecksFrequencySeconds.description: The frequency in seconds for resource health checks. Must be between 10 and 3600 seconds. Defaults to 60.

connectorId.description: The ID of the Connector this configuration is linked to.

logLevel.description: The log level to be configured for this Connector.

formal:index/connectorHostname:Connector.description: Registering a Connector Hostname with Formal.

certificate.description: The TLS certificate for this hostname. It should be in PEM format and only be set if the hostname is not managed by Formal.

connectorId.description: The ID of the Connector this hostname is linked to.

dnsRecord.description: The DNS record for this hostname.

dnsRecordStatus.description: The status of the DNS record for this hostname. Accepted values are `none`, `pending`, `success` and `failed`.

hostname.description: The hostname for this Connector hostname.

managedTls.description: Deprecated: If set to true, Formal will manage the TLS certificate for this hostname.
managedTls.deprecationMessage: This field is deprecated and has no effect. It will be removed in a future release.

privateKey.description: The TLS private key for this hostname. It should be in PEM format and only be set if the hostname is not managed by Formal.

terminationProtection.description: If set to true, this connector hostname cannot be deleted.

tlsCertificateStatus.description: The status of the TLS certificate for this hostname. Accepted values are `none`, `issuing`, and `issued`.

formal:index/encryptionKey:EncryptionKey.description: Registering an Encryption Key with Formal.

algorithm.description: The algorithm used for encryption. Can be either 'aes*random' or 'aes*deterministic'.

createdAt.description: When the encryption key was created.

decryptorUri.description: The URI of the decryptor (e.g., a URL to a Lambda function, either directly or via API Gateway). This is used to decrypt the data on the frontend only (and is never called by the Formal Control Plane backend).

keyId.description: The ID of the key in the provider's system (e.g., key ARN for AWS KMS).

keyProvider.description: The provider of the encryption key. Currently only 'aws' is supported.

workerCode.description: The code that will be executed to fetch and output the data.

workerRuntime.description: The execution environment for the code. It can be one of the following: 'python3.11' or 'nodejs18.x'.

workerSchedule.description: Second-based 'cron' expression specifying when the data should be fetched. For example, use '*/10 * * * * *' to run the code every 10 seconds.

formal:index/resourceClassifierConfigura.description: A Resource Classifier Configuration is a configuration for a resource classifier.

aiAnalysisScope.description: Which direction to apply AI analysis. Required. Supported values are `request` or `response`. Use preference=none to disable AI analysis entirely.

aiAnalysisTimeoutSeconds.description: The timeout for the AI analysis in seconds.

createdAt.description: The timestamp of the Resource Classifier Preference creation.

enforceStrictClassifierResultCount.description: Whether to fail requests if the number of results from the classifier is not equal to the number of key-value pairs sent to it.

preference.description: The preference. Supported values are `nlp`, `llm`, `both`, and `none`.

resourceId.description: The ID of the Resource.

updatedAt.description: The timestamp of the Resource Classifier Preference update.

formal:index/resourceTlsConfiguration:Re.description: Creating a TLS Configuration of a Resource in Formal.

resourceId.description: Resource ID for which the TLS configuration is applied to.

tlsCaTruststore.description: PEM encoded CA certificate to verify resource certificates. Only required if resource certificates are not trusted by the root CA truststore.

tlsConfig.description: Validation mode for the TLS configuration. Supported values are: `disable` (no TLS), `insecure-skip-verify` (TLS without verification), `insecure-verify-ca-only` (verify CA only), `verify-full` (full certificate verification).

tlsMinVersion.description: Minimum TLS version to be used for connections.

formal:index/workflow:Workflow.description: Workflows enable automation of actions based on triggers. A workflow is defined using YAML code that specifies a trigger (what starts the workflow) and actions (what the workflow does).

name.description: The name of the workflow. Must be unique within the organization.

status.description: The workflow status. Accepted values are `active` and `draft`.
